Topic.Title: So far, three downgrades and counting

Message.Msg: Insiders are busy selling. Although this can't be generalized as a huge negative, nevertheless, it can't be a positive either.

Topic.Title: So far, three downgrades and counting

Message.Msg: "it can't be a positive either." Not necessarily. Because of insider information trading issues, active officers have certain windows of time in which they can sell. Shares are a large part of their annual compensation. In many cases, they are selling only to diversify.

Topic.Title: So far, three downgrades and counting

Message.Msg: Couldn't agree more TB. you may not post as often as you used to, but it always a pleasure to read what you have to say. You're so right to state how a disappointing report...which really wasnt all that bad...didn't tank the stock as the Trollers would lead you to believe. Armageddon came and went with a buck and a half loss. I'll take it. I also agree with you that were the market to take a big hit for whatever reason, T will follow suit along with everything else. Very few companies are immune to market sell-offs. This business has its up's & down's and if investors can't take the volatility, try CD's or a bank savings account.

Topic.Title: WSJ: Prepare for Obamacare Shock

Message.Msg: No. Oliver Wyman Consultants estimates that single adults aged 21-29 who are not added to their parent's health insurance (which those age 21-26 can be under Obamacare), who do not have health insurance through an employer, who earn 400% of the FPL (about $46,000), and who choose the best plans in the exchange, may increase by as much as 42% in some states--but you guys just can't help lying, can you? Oliver Wyman also notes that under the ACA, these 21-29 year olds can opt to purchase a catastrophic coverage plan (the plan most often chosen by young, healthy individuals)--which Wyman notes is unaffected by Obamacare, will be much cheaper than other plans on the exchange, and provides a great safety valve for those on the exchange who may experience increases in traditional plans). That's the short criticism of Kessler, who works for the Hoover Institute. Wyman's prediciton for some 21-29 year olds is widely cited by AHIP, without referencing the caveats and alternatives cited by Wyman himself. You can read Wyman's article. Just do a Google search for "Oliver Wyman" and "Contingencies" where the article appeared in January.

Topic.Title: Obama: "I AM NOT the Strapping Young Muslim Socialist I Use to Be!

Message.Msg: No, you don't know much about Obama. Obviously you never listen to him. A more patriotic and more American values President there could not be. Obama was born on August 4, 1961, at Kapiʻolani Maternity & Gynecological Hospital (now Kapiʻolani Medical Center for Women and Children) in Honolulu, Hawaii,[2][5][6] and is the first President to have been born in Hawaii.[7] His mother, Stanley Ann Dunham, was born in Wichita, Kansas, and was of mostly English ancestry.[8] His father, Barack Obama, Sr., was a Luo from Nyang’oma Kogelo, Kenya. Obama's parents met in 1960 in a Russian class at the University of Hawaiʻi at Mānoa, where his father was a foreign student on scholarship.[9][10] The couple married in Wailuku on Maui on February 2, 1961,[11][12] and separated when Obama's mother moved with her newborn son to Seattle, Washington, in late August 1961, to attend the University of Washington for one year. In the meantime, Obama, Sr. completed his undergraduate economics degree in Hawaii in June 1962, then left to attend graduate school at Harvard University on a scholarship. Obama's parents divorced in March 1964.[13] Obama Sr. returned to Kenya in 1964 where he remarried; he visited Barack in Hawaii only once, in 1971.[14] He died in an automobile accident in 1982.[15] In 1963, Dunham met Lolo Soetoro, an Indonesian East–West Center graduate student in geography at the University of Hawaii, and the couple were married on Molokai on March 15, 1965.[16] After two one-year extensions of his J-1 visa, Lolo returned to Indonesia in 1966, followed sixteen months later by his wife and stepson in 1967, with the family initially living in a Menteng Dalam neighborhood in the Tebet subdistrict of south Jakarta, then from 1970 in a wealthier neighborhood in the Menteng subdistrict of central Jakarta.[17] From ages six to ten, Obama attended local Indonesian-language schools: St. Francis of Assisi Catholic School for two years and Besuki Public School for one and a half years

Topic.Title: WSJ: Prepare for Obamacare Shock

Message.Msg: Democrats own Obamacare not a single republican voted for it.

Topic.Title: WSJ: Prepare for Obamacare Shock

Message.Msg: "These stripped down policies are probably not worth the cost since they cover almost none of the normal care you get today." Good point. But Republicans seemed to think they were a better alternative than a public option, so I don't know what to tell you. Many Republicans also argue that we should ALL be on these plans because health insurance should only cover catastrophe (as insurance is generally supposed to do) but we've gotten used to health insurance acting like a benefit that shields buyers from the real cost of healthcare. In other words, we expect to be able to visit the doctor whenever we want for a $15 copay regardless of the costs. Catastrophic insurance doesn't cover doctor's visits, so you would limit visits and choose lower cost providers. This is the essence of many Republican plans to deal with health care costs. "the Congressional Budget Office estimates that Obamacare will cause 3 million people to lose their insurance completely in 2014. And it expects that 6 million will have to pay the individual-mandate tax penalty in 2016, because they don't want or can’t afford coverage." Not at all. The CBO expects 3 million people will find it beneficial to move from their current insurance to the exchanges. They expect that in2016 6 million people will choose to pay the penalty rather than purchase insurance. Many of these will be from Republican states who do not choose to expand Medicaid--leaving a big hole in coverage options for the poor. So, if you have a problem with that, kick Republicans out of state office.

Topic.Title: Obamacare key author calls it a train wreck and will quit

Message.Msg: "The AETNA CARTEL would not even insure me." Under Obamacare, the AETNA Cartel will have to insure you. They will not be able to deny you coverage because of your age or any other pre-existing condition. "YOUR RATES WILL CHANGE" Yes, they will likely go down for someone your age. Insurers will have limits on how much they can increase premiums due to age--and insurers raise premiums alot because of age. This means more of the health cost for you will be born by young people and by taxpayers through the exchange subsidies. Additionally, you may have direct access to subsidies on the exchange, depending on your income. Kaiser is one of the best and most affordable systems out there. If you are having trouble affording them or don't think their coverage is good enough, you should be very much looking forward to 2014. Hopefully then you will realize how much you've been lied to, and change your voting patterns accordingly.

Topic.Title: WSJ: Prepare for Obamacare Shock

Message.Msg: They are upset because they are ready, or because they will not be ready? Most states are operating their own exchanges. The rest (17) will default to the Federal exchange. Setting up the Federal Exchange will take money-- money which the Republican house has withheld. But as I noted in a previous post Republican governors are getting very, very nervous about this. They are worried about how they will look compared to states that have well functioning systems. So Republicans have been loosening the purse strings on this. It is a tight timeline in many cases, but I am confident the exchanges will be ready to go.

Topic.Title: WSJ: Prepare for Obamacare Shock

Message.Msg: "Great drive young families with young children" No, you have that backwards. What is actually occurring is that most of these families will now be able to afford more comprehensive coverage if they want it. Right now, people who don't have employer-sponsored insurance get catastrophic coverage if they can afford coverage at all. After the ACA these people will have expanded access to subsidized comprehensive insurance or Medicaid. "How can that be?" Because that's how the law works. The CBO estimates that 3 million people will lose employer coverage because the coverage on the exchange will be better and cheaper. These will likely be low wage workers who currently only get offered catastrophic coverage from their employers, but will have access to subsidized comprehensive coverage on the exchange.

Topic.Title: Today's Volume

Message.Msg: I don't know what to think. This morning it was very clear that Institutions where switching from VZ to T. However at 3 PM institutional trading went way up and T joined VZ in a one hour plunge. Institutional trading is largely computer controlled and it is almost like the computers have gone to day trading. Volume today was below average for T but way above average for VZ. T closed up a dime from yesterday and VZ was down $1.51. I started the week with 10 weekly 38 calls and, when T climbed today, I bought 30 more contracts thinking it would continue up. Now they are only worth a nickel and I paid a dime. I can only hope that T climbs above $38 tomorrow.

Topic.Title: Meanwhile, T is quietly sneaking up on 38...

Message.Msg: Sue away. You were looking at level II trading and I was looking at the one minute chart. I think that will be an adequate defense. What did you think of that wild last hour today? I'm glad I was out to lunch or I would have made some stupid move. Now I am ready for a big run up tomorrow. (I hope)

Message.Title: 5 year old shoots 2 year old sister...
Message.Msg: ...“BURKESVILLE, Ky. (AP) — A 5-year-old boy accidentally shot his 2-year-old sister to death in rural southern Kentucky with a rifle he had received as a gift last year, authorities said. The children's mother was home at the time of the shooting Tuesday afternoon but had stepped out to the front porch for a few minutes and ‘she heard the gun go off’…the girl died of a single gunshot wound to the chest area. The company that made the gun, Milton, Pa.-based Keystone Sporting Arms, produced 60,000 Crickett and Chipmunk rifles in 2008, according to its website. It also makes guns for adults, but most of its products are geared toward children….Keystone opened in 1996 with just four employees, producing 4,000 rifles that year. It now employs about 70 people... The smaller guns come in all sorts of colors, including blue and pink…The company's slogan is ‘My First Rifle’…” end So, if 4 employees made 4000 rifles a year, one would suppose that 70 employees could make 70,000 little blue and pink .22 caliber weapons named chipmunk for five year olds. I wonder if the two year old sister had one? Maybe he had Chipmunk and she had Crickett? Only in America.

Topic.Title: WSJ: Prepare for Obamacare Shock

Message.Msg: Not sure what number you are looking at. In August 2012—about six months ago—it estimated that 4 million people would lose ESI. It now estimates that 7 million Americans will lose ESI due to Obamacare. Also, employers are now anticipated to pay $13 billion more in penalties compared to the August 2012 baseline, totaling $130 billion over 10 years.

Topic.Title: 5 year old shoots 2 year old sister...

Message.Msg: What a truly sad and regrettable story. It is sad and regrettable on so many levels that it leaves a compassionate person with both sorrow and dread: o It is sad that a two year old little girl will never know her loving family or the potential of her life o It is sad that her mother will spend the rest of her life in grief and questioning her life choices (i.e., If only I had locked the gun in the gun safe, If only I had not gone out on the porch, If only I had not got the gun for my son, So many if I had not thoughts that they build on themselves) o It is sad that a 5 year-old little boy will spend the rest of his life with the death of his little sister on his hands. There will be so many guilty days and nights that will scar this child and make his life and dreams a mere shadow of what they could have been I admit that it is hard to find any good that could come out of this story, but it does place a big spotlight on the need for gun safety education for both parents and children. Thankfully this has been the primary mission of the NRA over the years, and it makes a case for parents and children enrolling in these classes as soon as possible. I pray for these folks, and hope for the grace of God to comfort them. "In your heart you know he is right." The Frogg
